Nightshift tries to shift his body in a more comfortable position.  Now tha=
t Ramulus had done some repairs, he could feel his lower body again.  Unfor=
tunately the pain of his injuries were now catching up to him.

"Ugh,slag, =
maybe I'd be better off if I couldn't feel anything. This really hurts now.=
"

Grunts Nightshift as he stays still to avoid making things too painful f=
or himself. 

"Maybe trad'n in the wheels for paws might not be such a bad =
idea after all."

Sent from my iPhone

On Jun 14, 2011, at 2:17 PM, Super C=
yclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

>> <OLD>
>> 
>> Night Shift gives=
 Ramulus a casual smile.  He had often thought of what it
>> would be like =
to pad around on four feet rather than roll on four wheels.
>> 
>> "Funny y=
ou should mention that Ramulus, I kinda wondered what my life would
>> be l=
ike if I did trade in the vehicle alt form for a beast form..  If I
>> coul=
d, it would probably be some sorta feline, same color, ellusive, quiet
>> o=
n the paws...  Oh yeah, that would be my choice if it was available.  But
>=
> actually I kinda like what I got now.  Sure, it's a pain in the tail pipe=

>> when I break down but, it does get me around from point A ta point B in=
 a
>> good amount of time.  And rolln' on wheels is alot easier than walkn'=
,
>> that's for sure."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> RAMULUS nodded as he looked around t=
he cave and then back at NIGHT
> SHIFT. =E2=80=9CI am sure that one of the =
medics can be talked into setting

> =E2=80=9CBut then again I have bee=
n trying to talk Rodimus into it for a while
> now. He said he thought abou=
t being a bat. I almost had him into it,
> but he changed his mind.=E2=80=
=9D
> 
>> <OLD>
>> 
>> He looks outside the cave.
>> 
>> " That's when I ca=
n walk.  I'm really gonna slow ya down Ramulus.  I hate
>> don' that ta ya.=
"
> 
> There was a smile as RAMULUS turned to look back at NIGHT SHIFT,
> =
=E2=80=9CDon=E2=80=99t worry about it. It sounds like the rain is beginning=
 to let up.
> We should hopefully be able to leave soon.=E2=80=9D
>

 as RAMULUS spoke the sound of the rain fall was slacking up,
> turning slo=
wly from a down pour and becoming more of a drizzle. There

ound of a bird or two from outside, sure signs of coming
